p: The extracted EOs using HD and MAE methods showed variable antimicrobial activities ( Table 3 and Table 4). The EOs of T. polium, extracted by HD and MAE methods, showed only antibacterial activity against the tested strains (Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria). However, the EOs of T. decussatus revealed a higher activity, as they showed both antibacterial and antifungal activities. T. decussatus EOs extracted using two different extraction methods exhibited a potent inhibitory effect against all bacterial strains, with an inhibition zone of 34–39 mm, and very strong antifungal activity, especially against the filamentous fungi, Aspergillus niger and Fusarium solani, with an inhibition zone of 40–48 mm.
